page.title: 04Roman Procession
page.content: A day of Roman style fun took over much of the Vale of Glamorgan. The march was in aid of two worthy causes: caring for the needy children of Barnardos and helping the Heritage Coast Project to provide 'talking posts' in Dunraven Garden for the blind to enjoy. The Legionaries formed up on the old Roman Road in Cowbridge to re-enact the style of the invaders from nearly 2,000 years ago. Led by the cavalry, the legion halted outside Cowbridge Town Hall - also on a Roman Road - where they were met by the senators. Tribune Gareth Williams, former Welsh Rugby International, sought permission from Senator Alan Rees, Mayor of Cowbridge, to form a legion. The rostrum party were as well turned out in costume as the horses, chariots, legionaries and slaves. The march was over a 7 mile course.
